criteria: Understanding and representation of positive and negative numbers in real-world contexts.
Explanation of the meaning of zero in different real-world situations.
Ability to use positive and negative numbers to accurately represent quantities.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of positive and negative numbers or their use in describing real-world quantities.
Student shows minimal understanding of positive and negative numbers, struggling to apply them to real-world contexts.  Representation is often incorrect or nonsensical.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of positive and negative numbers but has difficulty consistently applying them to real-world contexts. Representation may contain some errors.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of positive and negative numbers and can generally apply them to real-world contexts with reasonable accuracy.  Representation is mostly correct.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of positive and negative numbers, accurately applying them to various real-world contexts.  Clear and correct representation is shown.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of positive and negative numbers, expertly applying them to complex real-world contexts. Provides insightful and accurate representations, going beyond basic expectations.
Student cannot explain the meaning of zero in any real-world context.
Student struggles to explain the meaning of zero, providing explanations that are unclear, inaccurate, or irrelevant.
Student demonstrates a limited understanding of the meaning of zero in some real-world contexts, with explanations lacking clarity or completeness.
Student can adequately explain the meaning of zero in common real-world contexts, such as temperature or elevation.
Student clearly and accurately explains the meaning of zero in a variety of real-world contexts, demonstrating a strong grasp of the concept.
Student provides insightful and nuanced explanations of the meaning of zero in diverse and complex real-world situations, showcasing a deep understanding.
Student is unable to represent quantities using positive and negative numbers.
Student attempts to represent quantities but struggles with the correct sign or magnitude, resulting in inaccurate representations.
Student can represent some quantities with positive and negative numbers but makes frequent errors or inconsistencies.
Student generally represents quantities accurately using positive and negative numbers, with occasional minor errors.
Student consistently and accurately represents quantities using positive and negative numbers, demonstrating a strong command of the concept.
Student expertly and precisely represents quantities using positive and negative numbers, even in complex or ambiguous situations, demonstrating a mastery of the skill.
